intro: Warneria augusta, commonly known as the yellow warneria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while the stems are often woody and branched. Warneria augusta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
